summary: The 'Consumer Safety Technology Act' (S. 2766) focuses on consumer protection through technology. It mandates the Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) to pilot an artificial intelligence program to improve consumer product safety, including hazard identification and market monitoring. The bill also directs the Secretary of Commerce and the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) to study the use of blockchain technology for consumer protection and to report on unfair or deceptive practices related to tokens, providing recommendations for improved consumer safeguards in the digital asset space.
